intro: Centaurium erythraea subsp. bernardii, commonly known as the Bernard's redhead, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright red flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger flowers and more robust growth compared to the typical C. erythraea. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
